headline.main: Government's Racketeering Case Against Tobacco Companies Wraps Up Its First Phase

docs.abstract: Federal government's racketeering case against nation's largest cigarette companies reaches end of first phase after seven months of testimony; trial will move into its final stage after week recess (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: After seven months of testimony, the federal government's racketeering case against the nation's largest cigarette companies reached the end of its first phase on Thursday as lawyers disputed whether the companies had misled the public about the health effects of smoking. After a recess next week, the trial will move into its final stage, witness testimony on remedies that the judge, Gladys Kessler of Federal District Court, may apply if she decides in favor of the government.
docs.snippet: Lawyers disputed whether the companies had misled the public about the health effects of smoking.
